Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods

Class Eros

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.GodStrategy
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.Eros
public class Eros
extends GodStrategy
This class implements the Eros strategy used by the Player who chose the powers of this God. Specifically, Eros imposes a Game Preparation constraints: the Player's worker must be placed at opposite borders when the match starts. Moreover, it has some additional Win Conditions: Eros Player wins also if one workers moves to a position adjacent to the other (unmoved) worker's position (they must also be both on the level one, or the same level in a 3-Players Match).

  • Method Details

    • checkGamePreparation

      public boolean checkGamePreparation​(Worker workerFirst, Cell workerFirstCell, Worker workerSecond, Cell workerSecondCell)
      This method checks that Eros Game Preparation constraints are satisfied: the workers must be at opposite sides of the Match board.
      Overrides:
      checkGamePreparation in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      workerFirst - the "first" Player Worker.
      workerFirstCell - the cell in which the Player wants to put the "first" Worker at startup.
      workerSecond - the "second" Player Worker.
      workerSecondCell - the cell in which the Player wants to put the "second" Worker at startup.
      Returns:
      true if the Game Preparation constraints are satisfied, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      checkOppositeBorder(Cell, Cell)

    • checkOppositeBorder

      private boolean checkOppositeBorder​(Cell workerFirstCell, Cell workerSecondCell)
      This method checks that the workers given as parameter are at opposite border of the game Board.
      Parameters:
      workerFirstCell - the cell in which the Player wants to put the "first" Worker.
      workerSecondCell - the cell in which the Player wants to put the "second" Worker.
      Returns:
      true if the Cells are at opposite borders of the game Board, false otherwise.

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      This method first calls superclass execute move to actually move the worker. Then it sets the flag that represents Eros Win Condition.
      Overrides:
      executeMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.

      public boolean checkWinCondition​(Worker worker)

      Overrides:

      Parameters:
